intro: Cracca pusilla, commonly known as the dwarf cracca, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of only a few centimeters, with narrow, grass-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its compact size and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
